data.title: Dow is on track to fall for the fifth straight week
data.description: Even with the pandemic, the stock market enjoyed gains in 2020 and 2021. But is the party on Wall Street over?

data.title: Santoli: March has a knack for market trend reversals, and an inflection point approaches
data.description: This is the daily notebook of Mike Santoli, CNBC’s senior markets commentator, with ideas about trends, stocks and market statistics.

data.title: These are Goldman's favorite energy stocks to play the oil surge
data.description: With oil prices elevated as Russia's invasion of Ukraine raises concerns about global supply, Goldman Sachs highlighted its favorite energy stocks.

data.title: Biden warns Russia will pay a 'severe price' if it uses chemical weapons in Ukraine
data.description: President Joe Biden warned on Friday that Russia will pay a "severe price" if the country uses chemical weapons in Ukraine.

data.title: Could Middle East nations come to the rescue as the Ukraine war drives up oil prices?
data.description: The UAE suggested that it may support an increase in oil output within the framework of OPEC+. We ask energy expert Amena Bakr how likely that is to happen.

data.title: More women in the boardroom could drive higher credit ratings and stock returns for firms — they still hold just 29% of seats
data.description: About a third of corporate board seats are now held by women, and gender diversity in boardrooms could lead to higher credit ratings and stock performance.

data.author: Megan Durisin
data.title: Record Food Prices Could Leap 22% More on Ukraine War, UN Warns
data.description: Record Food Prices Could Leap 22% More on Ukraine War, UN Warns

data.title: Investing Club: What Cramer is watching Friday — stocks pop on "positive shifts," a sell signal for oil, Oatly bombs
data.description: Dow futures were up heading into Friday's opening bell on hopes that Russia and Ukraine might soon agree to a ceasefire.

data.title: Allbirds launches ReRun, a gently used marketplace with lower price points
The Ukraine war — like all conflicts — will hit women and girls the hardest, UN warns
data.description: Woman and girls pay the "highest price" during conflicts like the one in Ukraine, the executive director of U.N. Women told CNBC.
